TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SERVICE AGREEMENT 

EFFECTIVE AS OF DIC.2017


Following the European Union Directives and Regulations in Data Protection policies and the German laws on the specific field, “Rent Kitchen” (The Firm, we, us) consider a priority to apply the existing related regulation and presents the following document with all the Terms and Conditions rules and laws and how The Firm will use the subsequent information. The document will illustrate the way The Firm collects and process the User’s data, presenting how The Firm will adhere to data security standards regarding the user’s data. Furthermore, the following document will inform the plausible User about the contractual clauses if the User accepts to receive the Firm’s services.  


  1. DEFINITIONS For the purpose of this document the following definition applies:


  1.  1.1.A "User" means the natural person or undertaking that has been accepted the following Terms and Conditions and has a current account with The Firm
  2.  1.2.A “Member” means a person or entity that signs-up to the The Firm Platform including but not limited to Hosts, Operators and Facilitators.
  3.  1.3.A “Member Content” means all content that a Member posts, uploads, publishes, submits, transmits, or includes in their Listing, Member Account or The Firm promotional campaign to be made available through the Platform.
  4.  1.4.An “Operator” means a Member who requests from a Host a Booking in respect of a Listing for use of a Kitchen by that Member and/or a Member who uses the Kitchen(s) for their own benefit (e.g. food or catering business etc.)
  5.  1.5.A “Facilitator” means a Member who requests from a Host a Booking in respect of a Listing for use of a Kitchen by a third-party operator(s) and/or a Member that uses the Kitchen(s) for the benefit of third-party operators (e.g. delivery business etc.).
  6.  1.6.A "Third Party" means the natural person or undertaking that is not related to The Firm-User relation.  
  7.  1.7.A “Listing” means a Kitchen that is listed by a Host as available for Booking via the Platform.
  8.  1.8. A “Booking Request Period” means the time period starting from the time when a Booking is requested by an Operator or Facilitator (as determined by The Firm in its sole discretion), within which a Host may decide whether to confirm or reject that Booking request, as stated on the Platform. Different Booking Request Periods may apply in different places. 


  1. APPLICABILITY:


  1.  2.1.These Terms and Conditions are a legal contract between the user or visitor of the platform and The Firm. By accessing to our platform the user or visitor agreeing to all of the Terms and Conditions, if they do not agree with any of these Terms, they must not access or use any information contained in this platform.
  2.  2.2.The user’s general Terms and Conditions shall not apply, unless they are approved by The Firm through a written agreement. By using this service in any manner; including, but not limited to, visiting the site or contributing content, information, or other materials to the site, you agree to be bound by this Agreement. 


  1. GOVERNING LAW:


  1.  3.1.The governing law will be the ruling laws of the Federal Republic of Germany without regard to its conflict of law provisions, apply to this Terms of Service Agreement, not excluding the UN convention on contracts for the international sale of goods (CISG). The place of execution is the city of Berlin - Germany.
  2.  3.2.To the extent that the user is a merchant, a legal entity under public law or a public special asset; The German Capital - Berlin is the place of jurisdiction for all disputes arising from contractual relationships between the user and The Firm.
  3.  3.3.If any provision of these Terms and Conditions nor any clause of the following document is held to be invalid or unenforceable by a court, the remaining provisions of these Terms and Conditions will remain in effect. These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between us regarding our Services, and supersede and replace any prior agreements we might have between us regarding the Service.


  1. GENERAL:


  1.  4.1.The Firm’s employees are not authorized to make any verbal agreements with the user, which are not conforming to these Terms of Service Agreement.
  2.  4.2.If any provision of these Terms and Conditions be or become invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall remain unaffected. Instead of the ineffective regulation, an effective regulation whose economic purpose is as close as possible to the parties, shall apply.
  3.  4.3.Nothing in these Terms and Conditions obliges The Firm to make the Services available at any time or by any technological or direct means.
  4.  4.4.The Firm enables interactions, communications, bookings and payments between members via the platform. But is not a party to any booking between members and does not verify the suitability or ranking of the member, the kitchen or the listing. The services provided by The Firm in connection with the platform are limited to the enabling of bookings and collection and remittance of fees pursuant to these terms and conditions.
  5.  4.5.Members are wholly responsible for ensuring that their use of the platform and bookings enabled by it comply with any local or European applicable regulations, jurisdictional laws and third-party agreements in connection with the kitchen. Such regulations, laws and third-party agreements include, but are not limited to: Premises leases; Planning and building regulations; Food premises registration; Liquor licenses; Health and safety requirements; and Taxation regulations and laws. In addition, the user will be wholly responsible for any fees and charges incurred by them in connection with the platform and/or the kitchens (whether arising directly or indirectly).


  1. INFORMATION COLLECTION AND USE OF THE DATA


  1.  5.1.Regarding to the use of our services, The Firm will may ask the Users to provide The Firm certain personally identifiable information that shall be used to contact or identify the User. Personally identifiable information may include email address, name, and other relevant information like “personal information”. The following data will be collected as well, corresponding as IP address of the requesting computer, Date and time of access, Name and URL of the downloaded file, Volume of transmitted data, Confirmation whether the request was successful, Data identifying the browser and operating system, Website from which our site was accessed, among others.
  2.  5.2.This data is required for the use of the website (connection establishment, data transfer). We retain this information for purposes of system security, for technical administration of the network infrastructure as well as to improve the website, for a maximum of 24 hours.
  3.  5.3.Only system administrators have access to this data. An assessment of this data only takes place in the case of justified suspicion due to an attack on our network infrastructure or an improper use of our services.
  4.  5.4.The Firm may collect information about the User directly from the User and from third parties, as well as automatically through the User’s visit and use of our Site or Services.


  1. LOG DATA 


  1.  6.1.The Firm collects information that the User’s browser sends whenever the user visit our Service ("Log Data"). This Log Data may include information such as the user computer's Internet Protocol ("IP") address, browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages and other statistics.
  2.  6.2.In addition, The Firm may use third party services such as Google Analytics that collect, monitor and analyze this type of information in order to increase The Firm Service's functionality. These third-party service providers have their own privacy policies addressing how they use such information.
  3.  6.3.The information that The Firm collects from Social Networking Sites the user, also may log into the Site and Application through third party open authentication providers. By logging in through these, the users are granting The Firm access to the data provided by these. The Firm stores the information that The Firm receives alongside other information that The Firm collects from the users or receive about the User. The Firm may automatically collect the following information about the User of our Site or Services through cookies, web beacons, and other technologies: the user’s domain name; browser type and operating system; web pages, the view; links the user’s click; IP address; the length of time the User’s visits The Firm ’s Site and or use the user’s Services; and the referring URL, or the webpage that led you to The Firm ’s Site, and the following: access time, browser type, domain name, IP address, page views and referring URL.


  1. TYPES OF DATA COLLECTED 


  1.  7.1.USE OF COOKIES 
    1. Like many websites, The Firm uses "cookies" to collect information. A cookie is a small text file that is transferred to your computer’s hard disk for record-keeping purposes. The Firm uses cookies for two purposes. First, The Firm utilizes persistent cookies with a storage period of up to two years. These cookies will save the user’s registration data (User-ID and password, but no names) and if applicable language settings for future visits. Second, The Firm utilizes so called session ID cookies. Session ID cookies are deleted from the user’s computer when you log off from the site and service and then close your browser. The Firm uses these session ID cookies to better understand the user behavior on our website and to improve the appearance of the website for your device. The user can delete all of our cookies at any time. The Cookies will still exist even if the Firm changes his URL.
    2. The User may refuse / disable the use of cookies by changing the settings of the browser, however, this may mean the user cannot use all functions of this website. 
    3. Persistent cookies remain on the User’s computer after the User have closed the browser or turned off the computer. The Firm uses persistent cookies to track aggregate and statistical information about the User activity. 
    4. Third Party Cookies. The Firm may also engage third parties to track and analyse Site data. The Firm uses the data collected by such third parties to help the administer and improve the quality of the Site and to analyse Site usage.
    5. This Policy does not cover such third parties' use of the data. Disabling Cookies Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but if the user prefers can edit the browser options to block them in the future. The Help portion of the toolbar on most browsers will tell the users how to prevent their computer from accepting new cookies, how to have the browser notify you when they receive a new cookie, or how to disable cookies altogether. Visitors to The Firm Site who disable cookies will be able to browse certain areas of the Site, but some features may not function.


  1.  7.2.USE OF GOOGLE SERVICES 


  1. General Information 

Google Inc., located at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA (Google) provides website owners a variety of features and services to improve the detectability of websites in search engines, to advertise for and on the websites and to analyze the user behavior. The services of The Firm use are listed below.

Information and services from Google are automatically triggered when visiting The Firm’s website. In this case, Google becomes aware of the IP address of the user and usually requests more data from your device (e.g. cookies, device data, device ID, information about browser and software). If your device has a phone number, Google also requests this. Whether this data is sent from your device to Google depends on the settings of your device.

For all services from Google alone the Privacy Policy of Google applies, available at www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/.

  1. Google Analytics 

This website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service of Google Inc. (Google). Google Analytics uses cookies, small text files that are stored on your computer to help analyze how visitors use the website. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website is usually transferred to a server of Google in the USA and stored there. The Firm enabled the IP anonymization of Google so your IP address will be truncated within member states of the European Union or other States parties to the Agreement on the European Economic Area prior to the transfer. Only in exceptional cases the complete IP address is transmitted to a Google server in the USA and shortened there.

Google will use this information on behalf of the website operator to analyze the individual usage of the website, to create reports about website activities and to provide other services related to website and internet usage. In general, you can deactivate cookies (see 2.2) or install a browser-plugin that prevents the collection and analysis of data, generated by the cookie, and your behavior on the website (incl. your IP address) under the following link [https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=en].




  1. DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA


  1.  8.1.Personal Data is collected for the following purposes and using the following services: (The list of services and applications, named here is just illustrative
  2.  8.2.Analytics)

The services contained in this section enable the Owner to monitor and analyze web traffic and can be used to keep track of User behavior.

  1. Google Analytics (Google)
  2. Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). 
  3. Google utilizes the Data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services.
  4. Google may use the Data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookie and Usage data. Place of processing: USA.
  5. Google Tag Manager
  6. Google Tag Manager is a solution that allows marketers to manage website tags in an interface. The Tag Manager itself (which implements the tags) is a cookieless domain and does not collect any personal data. The tool activates tags that, as a result, might gather data. Google Tag Manager does not access or utilize this data if deactivation was carried out on a domain or cookie level, it remains for all tracking tags that are implemented with Google Tag Manager.
  7. Third Party Analytics We use automated devices and applications, such as Google Analytics, to evaluate usage of our Site. We also may use other analytic means to evaluate our Services. We use these tools to help us improve our Services, performance and user experiences. We do not share your personal information with these third parties. 


  1. LIMITATION OF DATA USE


  1.  9.1.All data collected by The Firm via the website will be collected, processed and used for the purpose of tailoring the service and for the purpose of providing the services offered by The Firm.
  2.  9.2.The Firm may also use the collected data of registered user for the purpose of advertising its own services, as permitted under §28 Section 3 BDSG (German Federal Data Protection Act) and §7 Section 3 UWG (Law Against Unfair Competition). The User can object to such use of your data at any time with effect for the future by e-mail to The Firm.





  1. TERMS OF SERVICE – DATA PROCESSING ORDER


  1.  10.1.Data provided to The Firm for analytical purposes will only be used by The Firm in order to create the analyses requested by the User. The user is always in complete control over the data; The Firm does not use the data for its own purposes or the purposes of third parties.
  2.  10.2.If The Firm receives access to data, that constitutes personal data in the meanings of § 3 Section 1 BDSG (German Federal Data Protection Law), depending on jurisdiction that applies to the user, an additional agreement for data processing might be required. This applies in particular to users that are subject to German or European Data Protection Law. The Firm provides for these cases an agreement which the user can request by e-mail at The Firm.

  1. KITCHEN LISTINGS


  1.  12.1.As a Host, you may create Listings. To create a Listing, you will be asked a variety of questions about the Kitchen to be listed that may include the location, capacity, size, features, and availability of the Kitchen and pricing and related rules and financial terms. All Listings must reflect the lowest advertised rate for the booking of the applicable Kitchen. Listings will be made publicly available via the Platform (including directly by The Firm to Operators and Facilitators). You understand and agree that the placement or ranking of Listings in search results may depend on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, Members preferences, ratings and/or ease of booking.
  2.  12.2.Other Members (i.e. Facilitators and Operators) will be able to book your Kitchen via the Platform based upon the information provided in your Listing, your Operator requirements, and Operators’ search parameters and preferences.
  3.  12.3.From time to time, Facilitators may create Bookings on behalf of undisclosed operators. Where an operator is undisclosed (i.e. not an Operator Member) Facilitators are bound to these Terms as if they are the Operator and must ensure that any third-party operators are made aware of and comply with these Terms in connection with the Booking. The Facilitator indemnifies and holds The Firm harmless in connection with any loss or damage in connection with the use of the Facilitator and a third–party operator of the Platform and the Services.

Please note that The Firm assumes no responsibility for a Host’s compliance with any agreements with or duties to third parties, applicable laws, rules and regulations. The Firm reserves the right, at any time and without prior notice, to remove or disable access to any Listing for any reason, including Listings that The Firm, in its sole discretion, considers to be objectionable for any reason, in violation of these Terms, or otherwise harmful to the Platform.
  6.  12.6.If an Operator requests a Booking of your Kitchen and uses your Kitchen, any agreement you enter into with such Operator is between you and the Operator. The Firm would not be a part of them, nor the consequences of such agreements will bind the Firm. You must specify any additional terms on your Listing.
  7.  12.7.You acknowledge and agree that, as a Host, you are responsible for your own acts and omissions and are also responsible for the acts and omissions of any individuals who use or are otherwise present at the Kitchen at your request or invitation, excluding the Operator or Facilitator (and the individuals the Operator or Facilitator invites to the Kitchen, if applicable.)

  1.  20.1.Security of the User’s Personal Information, The Firm has implemented commercially reasonable precautions, including, where appropriate, password protection, encryption, SSL, firewalls, and internal restrictions on who may access data to protect The Firm’s information we collect from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction.

The User should take steps to protect against unauthorized access to their password, phone, and computer by, among other things, signing off after using a shared computer, choosing a robust password that nobody else knows or can easily guess, and keeping your log-in and password private. The Firm is not responsible for any lost, stolen, or compromised passwords or for any activity on the account via unauthorized password activity.

  1. DURATION AND TERMINATION:

title: Terms of Service
body:
TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF SERVICE AGREEMENT 

EFFECTIVE AS OF DIC.2017


Following the European Union Directives and Regulations in Data Protection policies and the German laws on the specific field, “Rent Kitchen” (The Firm, we, us) consider a priority to apply the existing related regulation and presents the following document with all the Terms and Conditions rules and laws and how The Firm will use the subsequent information. The document will illustrate the way The Firm collects and process the User’s data, presenting how The Firm will adhere to data security standards regarding the user’s data. Furthermore, the following document will inform the plausible User about the contractual clauses if the User accepts to receive the Firm’s services.  


  1. DEFINITIONS For the purpose of this document the following definition applies:


  1.  1.1.A "User" means the natural person or undertaking that has been accepted the following Terms and Conditions and has a current account with The Firm
  2.  1.2.A “Member” means a person or entity that signs-up to the The Firm Platform including but not limited to Hosts, Operators and Facilitators.
  3.  1.3.A “Member Content” means all content that a Member posts, uploads, publishes, submits, transmits, or includes in their Listing, Member Account or The Firm promotional campaign to be made available through the Platform.
  4.  1.4.An “Operator” means a Member who requests from a Host a Booking in respect of a Listing for use of a Kitchen by that Member and/or a Member who uses the Kitchen(s) for their own benefit (e.g. food or catering business etc.)
  5.  1.5.A “Facilitator” means a Member who requests from a Host a Booking in respect of a Listing for use of a Kitchen by a third-party operator(s) and/or a Member that uses the Kitchen(s) for the benefit of third-party operators (e.g. delivery business etc.).
  6.  1.6.A "Third Party" means the natural person or undertaking that is not related to The Firm-User relation.  
  7.  1.7.A “Listing” means a Kitchen that is listed by a Host as available for Booking via the Platform.
  8.  1.8. A “Booking Request Period” means the time period starting from the time when a Booking is requested by an Operator or Facilitator (as determined by The Firm in its sole discretion), within which a Host may decide whether to confirm or reject that Booking request, as stated on the Platform. Different Booking Request Periods may apply in different places. 


  1. APPLICABILITY:


  1.  2.1.These Terms and Conditions are a legal contract between the user or visitor of the platform and The Firm. By accessing to our platform the user or visitor agreeing to all of the Terms and Conditions, if they do not agree with any of these Terms, they must not access or use any information contained in this platform.
  2.  2.2.The user’s general Terms and Conditions shall not apply, unless they are approved by The Firm through a written agreement. By using this service in any manner; including, but not limited to, visiting the site or contributing content, information, or other materials to the site, you agree to be bound by this Agreement. 


  1. GOVERNING LAW:


  1.  3.1.The governing law will be the ruling laws of the Federal Republic of Germany without regard to its conflict of law provisions, apply to this Terms of Service Agreement, not excluding the UN convention on contracts for the international sale of goods (CISG). The place of execution is the city of Berlin - Germany.
  2.  3.2.To the extent that the user is a merchant, a legal entity under public law or a public special asset; The German Capital - Berlin is the place of jurisdiction for all disputes arising from contractual relationships between the user and The Firm.
  3.  3.3.If any provision of these Terms and Conditions nor any clause of the following document is held to be invalid or unenforceable by a court, the remaining provisions of these Terms and Conditions will remain in effect. These Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between us regarding our Services, and supersede and replace any prior agreements we might have between us regarding the Service.


  1. GENERAL:


  1.  4.1.The Firm’s employees are not authorized to make any verbal agreements with the user, which are not conforming to these Terms of Service Agreement.
  2.  4.2.If any provision of these Terms and Conditions be or become invalid, the validity of the remaining provisions shall remain unaffected. Instead of the ineffective regulation, an effective regulation whose economic purpose is as close as possible to the parties, shall apply.
  3.  4.3.Nothing in these Terms and Conditions obliges The Firm to make the Services available at any time or by any technological or direct means.
  4.  4.4.The Firm enables interactions, communications, bookings and payments between members via the platform. But is not a party to any booking between members and does not verify the suitability or ranking of the member, the kitchen or the listing. The services provided by The Firm in connection with the platform are limited to the enabling of bookings and collection and remittance of fees pursuant to these terms and conditions.
  5.  4.5.Members are wholly responsible for ensuring that their use of the platform and bookings enabled by it comply with any local or European applicable regulations, jurisdictional laws and third-party agreements in connection with the kitchen. Such regulations, laws and third-party agreements include, but are not limited to: Premises leases; Planning and building regulations; Food premises registration; Liquor licenses; Health and safety requirements; and Taxation regulations and laws. In addition, the user will be wholly responsible for any fees and charges incurred by them in connection with the platform and/or the kitchens (whether arising directly or indirectly).


  1. INFORMATION COLLECTION AND USE OF THE DATA


  1.  5.1.Regarding to the use of our services, The Firm will may ask the Users to provide The Firm certain personally identifiable information that shall be used to contact or identify the User. Personally identifiable information may include email address, name, and other relevant information like “personal information”. The following data will be collected as well, corresponding as IP address of the requesting computer, Date and time of access, Name and URL of the downloaded file, Volume of transmitted data, Confirmation whether the request was successful, Data identifying the browser and operating system, Website from which our site was accessed, among others.
  2.  5.2.This data is required for the use of the website (connection establishment, data transfer). We retain this information for purposes of system security, for technical administration of the network infrastructure as well as to improve the website, for a maximum of 24 hours.
  3.  5.3.Only system administrators have access to this data. An assessment of this data only takes place in the case of justified suspicion due to an attack on our network infrastructure or an improper use of our services.
  4.  5.4.The Firm may collect information about the User directly from the User and from third parties, as well as automatically through the User’s visit and use of our Site or Services.


  1. LOG DATA 


  1.  6.1.The Firm collects information that the User’s browser sends whenever the user visit our Service ("Log Data"). This Log Data may include information such as the user computer's Internet Protocol ("IP") address, browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages and other statistics.

These third-party service providers have their own privacy policies addressing how they use such information.
  3.  6.3.The information that The Firm collects from Social Networking Sites the user, also may log into the Site and Application through third party open authentication providers. By logging in through these, the users are granting The Firm access to the data provided by these. The Firm stores the information that The Firm receives alongside other information that The Firm collects from the users or receive about the User. The Firm may automatically collect the following information about the User of our Site or Services through cookies, web beacons, and other technologies: the user’s domain name; browser type and operating system; web pages, the view; links the user’s click; IP address; the length of time the User’s visits The Firm ’s Site and or use the user’s Services; and the referring URL, or the webpage that led you to The Firm ’s Site, and the following: access time, browser type, domain name, IP address, page views and referring URL.


  1. TYPES OF DATA COLLECTED 


  1.  7.1.USE OF COOKIES 
    1. Like many websites, The Firm uses "cookies" to collect information. A cookie is a small text file that is transferred to your computer’s hard disk for record-keeping purposes. The Firm uses cookies for two purposes. First, The Firm utilizes persistent cookies with a storage period of up to two years. These cookies will save the user’s registration data (User-ID and password, but no names) and if applicable language settings for future visits. Second, The Firm utilizes so called session ID cookies. Session ID cookies are deleted from the user’s computer when you log off from the site and service and then close your browser. The Firm uses these session ID cookies to better understand the user behavior on our website and to improve the appearance of the website for your device. The user can delete all of our cookies at any time. The Cookies will still exist even if the Firm changes his URL.
    2. The User may refuse / disable the use of cookies by changing the settings of the browser, however, this may mean the user cannot use all functions of this website. 
    3. Persistent cookies remain on the User’s computer after the User have closed the browser or turned off the computer. The Firm uses persistent cookies to track aggregate and statistical information about the User activity. 
    4. Third Party Cookies. The Firm may also engage third parties to track and analyse Site data. The Firm uses the data collected by such third parties to help the administer and improve the quality of the Site and to analyse Site usage.
    5. This Policy does not cover such third parties' use of the data. Disabling Cookies Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but if the user prefers can edit the browser options to block them in the future. The Help portion of the toolbar on most browsers will tell the users how to prevent their computer from accepting new cookies, how to have the browser notify you when they receive a new cookie, or how to disable cookies altogether. Visitors to The Firm Site who disable cookies will be able to browse certain areas of the Site, but some features may not function.


  1.  7.2.USE OF GOOGLE SERVICES 


  1. General Information 

Google Inc., located at 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA (Google) provides website owners a variety of features and services to improve the detectability of websites in search engines, to advertise for and on the websites and to analyze the user behavior. The services of The Firm use are listed below.

Information and services from Google are automatically triggered when visiting The Firm’s website. In this case, Google becomes aware of the IP address of the user and usually requests more data from your device (e.g. cookies, device data, device ID, information about browser and software). If your device has a phone number, Google also requests this. Whether this data is sent from your device to Google depends on the settings of your device.

For all services from Google alone the Privacy Policy of Google applies, available at www.google.com/intl/en/policies/privacy/.

  1. Google Analytics 

This website uses Google Analytics, a web analytics service of Google Inc. (Google). Google Analytics uses cookies, small text files that are stored on your computer to help analyze how visitors use the website. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website is usually transferred to a server of Google in the USA and stored there. The Firm enabled the IP anonymization of Google so your IP address will be truncated within member states of the European Union or other States parties to the Agreement on the European Economic Area prior to the transfer. Only in exceptional cases the complete IP address is transmitted to a Google server in the USA and shortened there.

Google will use this information on behalf of the website operator to analyze the individual usage of the website, to create reports about website activities and to provide other services related to website and internet usage. In general, you can deactivate cookies (see 2.2) or install a browser-plugin that prevents the collection and analysis of data, generated by the cookie, and your behavior on the website (incl. your IP address) under the following link [https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout?hl=en].




  1. DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE PROCESSING OF PERSONAL DATA


  1.  8.1.Personal Data is collected for the following purposes and using the following services: (The list of services and applications, named here is just illustrative
  2.  8.2.Analytics)

The services contained in this section enable the Owner to monitor and analyze web traffic and can be used to keep track of User behavior.

  1. Google Analytics (Google)
  2. Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google Inc. (“Google”). 
  3. Google utilizes the Data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services.
  4. Google may use the Data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Personal Data collected: Cookie and Usage data. Place of processing: USA.
  5. Google Tag Manager
  6. Google Tag Manager is a solution that allows marketers to manage website tags in an interface. The Tag Manager itself (which implements the tags) is a cookieless domain and does not collect any personal data. The tool activates tags that, as a result, might gather data. Google Tag Manager does not access or utilize this data if deactivation was carried out on a domain or cookie level, it remains for all tracking tags that are implemented with Google Tag Manager.
  7. Third Party Analytics We use automated devices and applications, such as Google Analytics, to evaluate usage of our Site. We also may use other analytic means to evaluate our Services. We use these tools to help us improve our Services, performance and user experiences. We do not share your personal information with these third parties. 


  1. LIMITATION OF DATA USE


  1.  9.1.All data collected by The Firm via the website will be collected, processed and used for the purpose of tailoring the service and for the purpose of providing the services offered by The Firm.
  2.  9.2.The Firm may also use the collected data of registered user for the purpose of advertising its own services, as permitted under §28 Section 3 BDSG (German Federal Data Protection Act) and §7 Section 3 UWG (Law Against Unfair Competition). The User can object to such use of your data at any time with effect for the future by e-mail to The Firm.


  1. TERMS OF SERVICE – DATA PROCESSING ORDER


  1.  10.1.Data provided to The Firm for analytical purposes will only be used by The Firm in order to create the analyses requested by the User. The user is always in complete control over the data; The Firm does not use the data for its own purposes or the purposes of third parties.
  2.  10.2.If The Firm receives access to data, that constitutes personal data in the meanings of § 3 Section 1 BDSG (German Federal Data Protection Law), depending on jurisdiction that applies to the user, an additional agreement for data processing might be required. This applies in particular to users that are subject to German or European Data Protection Law. The Firm provides for these cases an agreement which the user can request by e-mail at The Firm.


  1. REGISTRATION AND CONDITIONS OF USE:

  2.  11.2.When the User register with The Firm, it will ask the User to provide the User company name, name of the company’s contact person, email address and a valid phone number, or any other pertinent information that the Firm may require. In the case of the use of paid services, the specification of payment data is required.
  3.  11.3.By using The Firm, you represent, acknowledge and agree that you are at least 18 years of age, or if you are under 18 years of age, but are at least 13 years old (a “Minor”), that you are using the Site with the consent of your parent or legal guardian and that you have received your parent’s or legal guardian’s permission to use the Site and agree to its Terms.   4.  11.4.The use of the services requires the registration as a user. Your Account user ID and password, along with any assigned keys or other credentials provided to you must be treated as confidential. The Firm will not be liable for any loss resulting from the unauthorized use of Your Account password or any assigned access keys or credentials. The user is obliged to provide true, accurate, current and complete registration data, and to maintain this by promptly updating the registration data, and other mandatory disclosures including payment information, when necessary. The Firm would not be a part of them, nor the consequences of such agreements will bind the Firm. You must specify any additional terms on your Listing.

  1. DURATION AND TERMINATION:

When a Booking is requested via the Platform, we will share with you: the name, details and business activities of the Operator or Facilitator who has requested the Booking.
    7. A Booking Fee is payable by the Operator or Facilitator to The Firm in full immediately upon confirmation of a Booking by a Host. The Booking Fee is comprised of the Kitchen Fee and the Service Fee.  
    8. Operators and/or Facilitators agree to pay The Firm the Booking Fee as outlined on the Platform. Operators and/or Facilitators authorize The Firm (and/or any third party payment processor of The Firm from time to time) to charge and deduct the Booking Fee from you using the Payment Details. The Firm will hold the Booking Fee in escrow for 14 days whereupon, save and except in the event of a Member Dispute, the Kitchen Fee will be remitted by The Firm to the Host (that is, the Booking Fee less the Service Fee and any other applicable fees and taxes) using the Host’s Payment Details.
    9. Notwithstanding that Member bookings ‘off Platform’ are a breach of these Terms, if any Member engages with, recruits or otherwise solicits another Member to complete a Booking independent of the Platform, the Host will remain liable to pay The Firm the Service Fee for any use of a Kitchen (by another Member) advertised on the Platform in the preceding 18 months, as if that Kitchen was the subject of a Booking(s) using the Platform.
    10. All amounts owed to The Firm under or in connection with these Terms constitute debts due and payable by you to The Firm until paid in full. You must pay all amounts due to The Firm without set-off, deductions counter-claims or conditions; and in available cleared funds. If an amount due under these Terms is paid after the due date you must pay The Firm, in addition to the overdue amount interest at the rate of 10% per annum calculated based on a 365 day year from the date of the default until the date the amount (together with all accrued interest) is paid in full; and all costs and expenses incurred by The Firm in collecting the overdue amount.
    11. All fees and charges shown on the Site and Application and identified in these Terms are Euros.

  1.  23.1.If, as an Operator or Facilitator, you wish to cancel a confirmed Booking made via the Platform, either prior to or after arriving at the Kitchen, the cancellation policy of the Host contained in the applicable Listing will apply to such cancellation. Our ability to refund the Kitchen Fees will depend upon the terms of the cancellation policy. Service Fees are non-refundable for an Operator’s or Facilitator’s cancellation of a confirmed Booking. Details regarding refunds and cancellation policies are available upon request.  
  2.  23.2.Hosts may not cancel a Booking later than 15 days prior to the Booking. If a Host cancels a confirmed Booking made via the Platform: The Firm will refund the Booking Fees for such Booking to the applicable Operator or Facilitator pursuant to these Terms; the Operator or Facilitator will receive a communication from The Firm to the effect of the cancellation; and the Host will be charged the Service Fee applicable to the Booking using the Host’s Payment Details.
  3.  23.3.If, as a Host, you cancel a confirmed Booking, you agree that The Firm may apply penalties or consequences to you or your Listing, including but not exclusive to: publishing an automated review on your Listing indicating that a Booking was cancelled; keeping the calendar for your Listing unavailable or blocked for the dates of the cancelled Booking; or immediately terminating your Account if more than one (1) cancellation occurs in any three (3) month period.
  4.  23.4.In certain circumstances, The Firm may decide, in its sole discretion, that it is necessary or desirable to cancel a confirmed Booking made via the Platform. The Firm may also determine, in its sole discretion, to refund to the Operator or Facilitator part or all of the amounts charged to the Operator or Facilitator, in which case the Kitchen Fee is not remittable to the Host. The Firm will initiate any refunds due to you pursuant to these Terms within 30 days, using your Payment Details.   


  1. DAMAGE TO KITCHENS AND SECURITY DEPOSITS


  1.  24.1.As an Operator or Facilitator, you are responsible for leaving the Kitchen (including any personal or other property located at the Kitchen) in the condition it was in when you arrived. You acknowledge and agree that, as an Operator or Facilitator, you are responsible for your own acts and omissions and are also responsible for the acts and omissions of any individuals whom you invite to, or otherwise provide access to, the Kitchen. In the event that a Host claims otherwise and provides evidence of damage including but not limited to photographs, you agree to pay the cost of replacing the damaged items with equivalent items.
  2.  24.2.Operators are required to complete the check-in and out form for every day occupying the kitchen.
  3.  24.3.Hosts may choose to include security deposits in there. Each Listing will require a Security Deposit for the applicable Kitchen. Rent out your kitchen space for as long as you want
Start earning money

Our platform Rent Kitchen enables commercial kitchens
in bars, restaurants, cafés and community centers
to be booked by chefs who want to cook

Get Started

Earn Extra Money Each Week

Rent it out by the day or by the week to our network of food professionals.
Earning extra money from your kitchen is safe and simple with Rent Kitchen.

  Seamless Communication with Interested chefs/cooks
